lines.text: no matter where you go, there you are.

Time counts and keeps countin', and we knows now finding the trick of what's been and lost ain't no easy ride. But that's our trek, we gotta' travel it. And there ain't nobody knows where it's gonna' lead. Still in all, every night we does the tell, so that we 'member who we was and where we came from... but most of all we 'members the man that finded us, him that came the salvage. And we lights the city, not just for him, but for all of them that are still out there. 'Cause we knows there come a night, when they sees the distant light, and they'll be comin' home.

Listen all! This is the truth of it. Fighting leads to killing, and killing gets to warring. And that was damn near the death of us all. Look at us now! Busted up, and everyone talking about hard rain! But we've learned, by the dust of them all... Bartertown learned. Now, when men get to fighting, it happens here! And it finishes here! Two men enter; one man leaves.
And what did you do before all this?
I was a cop, a driver.
But how the world turns. One day, cock of the walk. Next, a feather duster.
We call it Underworld. That's where Bartertown gets its energy.
Pig shit. The lights, the motors, the vehicles, all run by a high-powered gas called methane. And methane cometh from pig shit.
Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls... Dyin' time's here.
Welcome, to another edition of Thunderdome!
I don't know anything about methane.
You can shovel shit can't you?
I ain't Captain Walker. I'm the guy who carries Mr. Dead in his pocket.
These our witness, Aunty. Us suffer bad. Want justice. We want Thunderdome!
Two men enter, one man leaves.
This Blaster! Twenty men enter, only him leave!
Remember where you are - this is Thunderdome, and death is listening, and will take the first man that screams.
[Aunty Entity's men surround Max, until she makes them stand down]

[to Max]
Well, ain't we a pair, raggedy man.
[she laughs evilly and heads back to her truck]
[she and her men drive off, leaving Max alone in the desert]
Two men enter, one man leave!
Thunderdome. How do I get in there?
Perhaps you've got something to trade after all.
Twenty-four hours of your life, in return, you'll get back what was stolen.
Congratulations! You're the first to survive the audition!
Do you know who I was? Nobody. Except on the day after, I was still alive. This nobody had a chance to be somebody.
Uh huh. You've got a plane.

[Outside, a plane is being started]
It might just save your life.
[Pig Killer's leg been impaled to the door with a spear]
Okay, we're going to count to three. One...
[Max rips open the door, freeing Pig Killer's impaled leg]

[whimpering, in pain]
What happened to two...?
Right now, I've got two men, two men with a gut full of fear. Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls... dyin' times here!

[the Blaster has reduced Bartertown's power supply]
For God's sake, what now?
Dammit, I told you, no more embargos.
Who run Bartertown? Who... run... Bartertown?
[the Master turns on the town loudspeakers]

[armed with more guns than he can hold]
This is a stickup! Anybody moves, and they're dead meat!
[Max turns around and looks at the approaching vehicles]
Oh, no, I think we're all dead meat!
you take your chances with the law, justice is only a roll of the dice. A flip of the coin. A turn... of the Wheel.
I've got skills, I could trade them.

[trying to disarm Max' booby trapped vehicle]
I'll disconnect the battery!
How long are you in for?
I had to feed the kids. Ah, it doesn't bother me. Down here, life's two, three years.

[to the citizens of Bartertown]
Where are you gonna run? Where are you gonna hide? Listen to me! Bartertown will live! Find the little man! Bring him back to me! We will rebuild! For those who took him... No mercy.
This is no enemy. It's almost family.
The reasons don't concern you, only the conditions. Do you want the deal or not?
The first is, no one knows you're working for Aunty. You hit him, you go. The second is, it's a fair fight. The third is, it's to the death.
bust a deal and face the wheel!
The first place you'll find is a sleaze-pit called Bartertown. Now if the earth doesn't swallow you up first, that place sure as hell will!
Me order! Me Master! Me run Bartertown!
Sure, that's why you live in shit!
Call it what you like. It still smells like shit to me!
between them and us, there isn't enough runway.

[sees that Max has discovered Blaster's weakness]
Mr., who are ya?
No Mr., I can feel it! The dice are rollin'!

[giving instructions to Mad Max and Blaster prior to their battle]
Thunderdome's simple. Get to the weapons, use them any way you can. I know you won't break the rules, because there aren't any.

[after inspecting a bomb]
It's a class job. One mistake, and it'll blow the crap out of this place! Literally.
It just might save your life!
It just might save your life!
